structure.unit: FEES AND COMPENSATION OF PUBLIC OFFICERS AND EMPLOYEES

text.section:
Sheriffs, constables, coroners, marshals, and policemen shall be paid out of the State Treasury for the following services the following fees:
Apprehending a person on charge of felony, or a fugitive from justice charged with a felony in this state .............................. $10.00
Executing a process of contempt in a criminal case when the court excuses the contempt ........................................ 1.60
Executing a summons upon a witness in behalf of the Commonwealth in a felony case .............................................. 3.00
Summoning a jury, on order of a court, in a county other than that in which the action is pending, a reasonable allowance to be fixed by the court.
Summoning and attending a jury in a case of felony .................................. 2.50

No claim for services incidental to examining courts shall be allowed to any sheriff, deputy sheriff, constable, marshal, policeman, or other officer authorized to execute process in felony cases until the grand jury has returned an indictment for a felony.

law.history: Amended 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 248, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1996. -- Amended 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 366, sec. 1, effective July 14, 1992. -- Amended 1962 Ky. Acts ch. 254, sec. 1. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. secs. 353, 354, 4586.
